derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French, via Latin from Greek prou(m)non 'plum'
late 15th cent. (in the sense 'abbreviate'): from Old French pro(o)ignier, possibly based on Latin rotundus 'round'

entry.def: A prune is a dried plum.
When you prune a tree or bush, you cut off some of the branches so that it will grow better the next year.

example.ex: You have to prune a bush if you want fruit...
example.tran: 如果想让灌木结果，就必须进行修剪。

example.ex: There is no best way to prune.

entry.def: If you prune something, you cut out all the parts that you do not need.

example.ex: Firms are cutting investment and pruning their product ranges.
example.tran: 公司正在减少投资，缩减产品系列。

means.word_mean: 1. cultivate, tend, and cut back the growth of;
2. weed out unwanted or unnecessary things;

sentences.sentence: "We had to lose weight, so we cut the sugar from our diet"

list.explanation: 头脑迟钝的人，容易上当受骗的人，傻瓜

example.en: That guy over there looks like a perfect prune.
example.zh: 对的那个人看上去像个十足的傻瓜。

sentences.en: The workers have pruned all the dead branches.
sentences.cn: 工人们已经剪去了所有的枯枝。

jushi.english: It's the best time to prune.
We will have to prune public spending.
jushi.chinese: 我们将不得不削减公共开支。

jushi.english: We should prune waste in the health service to reduce government spending.
jushi.chinese: 我们应该减少保健服务中的浪费以削减政府开支。
